info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 8:19PM EDT until May 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have ended over the area. Rainfall amounts Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier thunderstorms. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 9 PM EDT this evening. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Tequesta, Juno Beach, Royal Palm Beach, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, Juno Ridge, North County Airport, Port Of Palm Beach, Schall Circle, The Acreage, Golden Lakes, Mangonia Park, Fau North Campus, Lakeside Green and Cypress Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING
